intro: Cicendia, commonly known as the red sandalwood or red sandal. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae, native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, woolly leaves. Its flowers are typically pale pink or white, with five petals, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Cicendia is adapted to survive in harsh environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils.
